intro: Adicea serrulata, commonly known as the serrated adicea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along riverbanks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are serrated, giving it its common name, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Adicea serrulata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
